As an old master of technology and systems programmer I have been looking for a scientific calculator, but with some extra functions. It must be possible to enter quite long and complicated expressions,  and possible to go back and edit corrections or variations. Also I want to convert to and calcul...Full ReviewAs an old master of technology and systems programmer I have been looking for a scientific calculator, but with some extra functions. It must be possible to enter quite long and complicated expressions,  and possible to go back and edit corrections or variations. Also I want to convert to and calculate in HEX and BIN. This calculator fullfil all my demands and is simple to use, and the free version has all I want. But I intend to buy the PRO version, not so much for the added functions, but mainly to support the project.

I needed a scientific calculator that does all the jobs including unit conversion and show the expression mode. Most others that I used did so, but after sometimes expression mode is gone. Or they show many ads. But this one is different. One suggestion enable Vinculum option for repeating decimal n...Full ReviewI needed a scientific calculator that does all the jobs including unit conversion and show the expression mode. Most others that I used did so, but after sometimes expression mode is gone. Or they show many ads. But this one is different. One suggestion enable Vinculum option for repeating decimal numbers. Thanks. Update :: Downloaded the app today, but still the vinculum option isn't available. Sigh!! üòë

The beautiful part is that there are NO ADDS ! It works only on portrait mod but I don't mind. Maybe in...Full ReviewIt says 'designed for phones' but it works also on tablets. I have installed it on Samsung Tab S3 SM-T825 and works very well. I don't need a scientific calculator but I will keep it just in case. The beautiful part is that there are NO ADDS ! It works only on portrait mod but I don't mind. Maybe in the future will be possible to change from portrait to landscape. I give it a 5 stars. Good job.

Perfect look and feel. It works my old, lovely scientific calculator. There is only one issue: on older smartphones like Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini it can't detect quick taps. I have to tap calculator buttons moderately. Sept 26th 2017: I installed the latest update. I tested the touch sensitivity. It i...Full ReviewPerfect look and feel. It works my old, lovely scientific calculator. There is only one issue: on older smartphones like Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini it can't detect quick taps. I have to tap calculator buttons moderately. Sept 26th 2017: I installed the latest update. I tested the touch sensitivity. It is now perfect. I can type numbers as fast as I'm able. Big thanks for the developer.
The features and customisation of the free app are great.  I'm not a scientist or a budding mathematician so... this calculator does all I  need.  Thanks.

The author has prompt and kind replies. Here therefore is a revised and less dry review. This is one of the best sci calcs, and to me perhaps the best. Powerful and quite complete functionality (even if fractions, factorization, LCM/MCD are missing at the moment). The display and the keyboard have e...Full ReviewThe author has prompt and kind replies. Here therefore is a revised and less dry review. This is one of the best sci calcs, and to me perhaps the best. Powerful and quite complete functionality (even if fractions, factorization, LCM/MCD are missing at the moment). The display and the keyboard have excellent graphics and realism, to a degree that goes beyond cosmetics and helps with usability and comfort. Some further step towards perfection could be these. The status indicators along the top side of the display need much more contrast. The logo above the keyboard is elegant but steals precious room for hosting two more keys; perhaps it could instead be displayed on the display when the calculator is initialized as a simulated LCD bitmap. Replace some of the more frivolous themes with new ones having high contrast key labels (white on dark to avoid offending the eyes) and slightly bolder characters especially for the second-function labels. Test all the themes in extreme light conditions; also have them tested by elderly people who happen to have lost their glasses... At present the most readable theme seems to be Black Leather.
The new update from 4.2 to version 5 unfortunately is so slow to display the results. I uninstalled it after the update.
